title: 104_hr1024
content: The text amends various sections of different laws by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with different entities such as the "Committee on Rules and Administration of the House of Representatives" and the "Public Printer". The text amends sections of various laws by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and makes amendments to titles 28, 40, and 44 of the United States Code. The text amends sections of title 44, United States Code, by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and making amendments to various sections. The text amends sections of title 44, United States Code, by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and making various amendments to sections 504, 505, 508, and 509. The text further amends sections of title 44, United States Code by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in sections 510, 511, and 512. Sections 513 and 514 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" for quality standards and decision-making processes. Section 515 of title 44, United States Code is amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing and give authority to the Public Printer instead. Section 517 is also amended to authorize the Public Printer directly. Additionally, sections 702 and 703 are updated to replace mentions of the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer. Section 703 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate or the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives." Section 707 is also amended to give the Public Printer authority to print bills or resolutions in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. The Public Printer is authorized to determine the style and form of ancillaries for efficiency until final enactment in Congress. Sections 709, 714, and 717 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer for rule establishment. Section 717, 718, and 721(a) of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer for rule establishment in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 722 and 723 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 724 is also amended. Section 724, 728, 738, and 901 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 902, 903, and 905 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Section 906 of title 44, United States code is amended to send copies not exceeding one hundred to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, as designated by them. Section 906 of title 44, United States code is amended to send copies not exceeding one hundred to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, as designated by them. The changes include providing ten semimonthly copies to the Committees, allowing eight copies to be bound as approved by the Public Printer, and specifying the delivery of daily edition copies unless directed otherwise. Section 1108 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing regulation by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1112 is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer". Section 1121 is amended to remove direction by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1301 is amended to remove directions of the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1320A is amended to remove approval of the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1333 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives." Section 1338 is also amended to remove limitations and conditions prescribed by the Joint Committee on Printing and to replace it with the "Public Printer." Section 1705, 1710, and 1914 of title 44, United States Code are amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 5(b) of the Federal Records Management Amendments of 1976 is also amended to eliminate mention of the Joint Committee on Printing. The Act and its amendments will take effect on the first day of the 9th month after enactment.
